instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no internal speaker-output -  <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> shorted in T2
threads.message:
This MB had a liquid damage at the audio-board and did get a new Audio board and flex cable.
But there is no output at the internal speakers. Output headphone is ok.

<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = low, diodemode is 0,512
<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = low, diodemode is 0,002

I removed <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6103</CAPACITOR> and the flexcabel to the audioboard. J6100 and all traces looks good.
So i think the short of <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is probably inside T2, what do yout think?

Could it be a solution, setting <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high with an jumperwire?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no internal speaker-output -  <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> shorted in T2
threads.message:
No way.
I had exact same problem and forced the reset signal, without success.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no internal speaker-output -  <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> shorted in T2
threads.message:
Sorry, there is a mistake in my first comment ...
The shorted rail is <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> and not <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. Here the correct values ...

<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = low, diodemode is 0,512
<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> = low, diodemode is 0,002

I'm afraid your answer is still the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no internal speaker-output -  <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> shorted in T2
threads.message: Exactly, if the short is inside T2...
